alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 3:07AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Lee, Des Moines, Henderson and Hancock Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jo Daviess and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. .Melting snowpack in the upper Midwest will increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Burlington. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water affects low lying buildings and homes in Montrose and Niota. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to 16.1 feet Sunday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
